result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy A Linn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Timothy A Linn is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Timothy A Linn was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*   Pay restitution in the sum of $1002.21 plus surcharges.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. DE appears in person with Atty Ted Kmiec.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  945 - Curt vacates BWAR and reinstates bond. Sentence recommendations. Restitution of $1002.21 ordered - nothing paid to date.   Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 12 months w/conditions. Court costs ordered.  Appeal rights given.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Attorney T Kmiec appeared on behalf of deft, who did not appear.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Kmiec states the deft left him a message that his car broke down.  Court forfeits bond and issues warrant $3,000 cash bond.
Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Atty T Kmiec appeared on behalf of deft, who did not appear.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  SEH adjourned to 9/21/16 at 3:30pm.  Bond continued.
Atty Kmiec is out sick today.  Sentencing hearing set for today at 3:30 is reset for 9/16/16 at 9:45.  Atty Kmiec and ADA Phan notified by email.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney T Kmiec.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Case set for sentencing.  ADA Phan states there was a restitution where an amount was set but the Commissioner allowed a supplemental bill to be submitted but the victim is having trouble obtaining the bill.  Court will subpoena the bill.  SEH adjourned to 8/22/16 at 3:30pm.  Bond continued.
Exhibits S1-S3 inventoried and stored in Br 1 exhibit room on 5/27/16. vm

851   Clerk HM.   Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  DE appears with Atty Kmiec.   Victim LB appears.    Victim LB sworn in and testified.       Trudy Blakely sworn in and testified.     Timothy Linn sworn in and testified.     Court hears argument.     Court orders restitution in the amt of $828.71 for ambulance bill, $80 and $93.50 for lost wages.  No restitution ordered for amt in Exhibit 2/UHS bill at this time.  State is allowed to supplement the record with an actual statement from 11/24 or 11/25/14 - submit invoice/bill/statement no later than 6/10/16 - copy to Atty Kmiec.   Atty Kmiec may object in writing - if no objection the amt of $1002.21 stands.
